item.title: Cycle lane closed - dangerous as heavily used, 5th November
item.description:
The cycle route / crossing across tower bridge road from Webb street into Rothesay street is closed, with no reason given and no date for when it will reopen. Temporary traffic lights are in place. No work being carried out. This is a very heavily used cycle crossing and it is now dangerous and confusing. Taxis and vans are now using the segment into Rothesay street as a rat run and this has caused the route to become dangerous. I use this route morning and night to take my kids to school, and donâ€™t understand why it is closed. No communication. Please reopen soonest.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webb Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 57 Belsize Park Gardens, 5th November
item.description:
Scaffolding company associated with "Travis Home Improvements" (using an unbranded scaffolding vehicle) has not reserved parking as is usual for this type of work. They are working on 55 Belsize Park Gardens. They have firstly parked in an electric vehicle charging space, as they are too long they were blocking most of the road and have since moved to completely block the pavement. As the 46 bus is on diversion down here, and other traffic, this is causing a lot of nuisance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Belsize Park Gardens, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
